cookieConsent.title: Cookie preferences
cookieConsent.description: Essential cookies keep this site running. Turn on analytics to allow Google Analytics tracking and help improve the experience. You can change your mind anytime.

essential.title: Essential
essential.description: Required for core features like theme and language choices.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.description: Measure visits and performance via Google Analytics.

footer.localStorageCopy: Preference data is stored locally in your browser. You can revisit this modal by clearing that storage or cookies.

metadata.title: Privacy Policy | Odock.ai
metadata.description: Learn how Odock.ai handles data for the waitlist and optional Google Analytics in line with GDPR requirements.

privacyPage.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPage.intro: We keep data collection limited to what is needed for the waitlist and to understand site usage when you accept analytics cookies. Everything is handled to remain GDPR compliant.

informationCollected.title: Information we collect
informationCollected.intro: Our site is intentionally minimal. We collect only the information you choose to share so we can manage the waitlist or respond to your inquiries.

bullets.label: Waitlist sign-up:
bullets.text: name, email, role, and optional team size so we can confirm your place on the list and send updates.

bullets.label: Contact and enterprise inquiries:
bullets.text: the details you provide (such as company, role, and message) plus hCaptcha verification to prevent spam.

bullets.label: Analytics (optional):
bullets.text: Google Analytics runs only after you accept analytics cookies. We view aggregated trends (e.g., page views, device/browser details) to improve the site.

bullets.label: Technical logs:
bullets.text: minimal logs for security and reliability (e.g., request metadata) retained for short periods.

usage.title: How we use your information
bullets: To send waitlist confirmations, product updates, or invitations to early access.
To respond to messages you send through the contact form.
To protect the service from abuse (spam prevention and security monitoring).
To understand how the site is used through aggregated analytics when you have opted in. We do not sell or share data for advertising.

cookies.title: Cookies and tracking
bullets: Essential cookies are limited to site reliability and spam prevention (e.g., hCaptcha).
Google Analytics cookies are set only after you accept them. Data is used in aggregate to improve the site, and you can withdraw consent at any time through your browser or the cookie controls.
We do not use advertising or social media tracking pixels.

sharing.title: Sharing and transfers
bullets: We share data only with service providers that help us operate the site (for example, hosting, email, form handling, analytics, and security). These providers are bound by data protection agreements.
We do not sell personal data.
Data may be processed outside your country, but always with protections consistent with GDPR.

retention.title: Retention
bullets: Waitlist and inquiry details are kept only as long as needed to manage access and conversations.
Analytics data is kept in aggregate form according to Google Analytics retention settings.
If you ask us to delete your data, we will remove it unless we need to keep it to meet legal or security obligations.

rights.title: Your rights
rights.copyBeforeEmail: If you are in the EU/UK (or similar jurisdictions), you can request access, correction, deletion, restriction of processing, portability, or withdraw consent for analytics at any time. To exercise these rights or ask a privacy question, contact us at

metadata.title: Terms of Use | Odock.ai
metadata.description: Terms for using the Odock.ai marketing site and waitlist, including acceptable use and limitations of liability.

termsPage.title: Terms of Use
termsPage.intro: These terms govern how you may use the Odock.ai marketing site, waitlist, and contact channels.

sections.title: 1. Using this site
paragraphs: The site is provided to share information about Odock.ai and to let you join the waitlist or contact us. You must use the site lawfully and agree to these terms each time you access it.

sections.title: 2. Waitlist and inquiries
bullets: Joining the waitlist does not guarantee product availability or timing.
Provide accurate information when you submit forms. We use it to contact you about access or to respond to your message.
You may ask to be removed from the waitlist or stop communications at any time.

sections.title: 3. Acceptable use
bullets: No interfering with or disrupting the site, security features, or infrastructure.
No attempting to access data that does not belong to you.
No automated scraping, scanning, or reverse engineering of the site without consent.
No use that violates applicable laws or regulations.

sections.title: 4. Analytics and cookies
paragraphs: We keep cookies limited. Google Analytics is used only if you accept analytics cookies so we can understand traffic in aggregate. See the Privacy Policy for details on data handling and your choices.

sections.title: 5. Intellectual property
paragraphs: All content on the site (brand, copy, graphics, and layout) is owned by Odock.ai or its licensors. You may not reuse it without prior written permission unless a specific license is provided.

sections.title: 6. Disclaimer
paragraphs: The site is provided "as is" for informational purposes. We may update or discontinue parts of the site at any time. To the fullest extent permitted by law, Odock.ai disclaims warranties of fitness, merchantability, and non-infringement.

sections.title: 7. Limitation of liability
paragraphs: To the extent permitted by law, Odock.ai is not liable for indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages arising from your use of the site. If liability cannot be excluded, it is limited to the amount you paid us for accessing the site (which is typically zero).

sections.title: 8. Changes to these terms
paragraphs: We may update these terms to reflect new features or legal requirements. If changes are material, we will note it on this page. Continued use of the site after changes means you accept the updated terms.

sections.title: 9. Contact
sections.contactPrefix: Questions about these terms? Reach us at

howItWorks.title: How Odock.ai Works
howItWorks.description: Built for teams managing complexity. Unified control with enterprise-grade reliability.

steps.title: Define Providers & Tools
steps.description: Register LLM providers, vector databases, and MCP tools. All become instantly accessible through a single standardized endpoint.

steps.title: Issue Virtual API Keys
steps.description: Create isolated API keys for organisations, teams, users, or projects with fine-grained policy controls and model-level permissions.

steps.title: Apply Security Guardrails
steps.description: Odock automatically enforces prompt injection protection, jailbreak filtering, rate limits, data leakage controls, and safe output rules.

steps.title: Define Budgets & Quotas
steps.description: Assign spending limits, token quotas, and usage caps per API key. Get real-time cost monitoring and automatic enforcement.

steps.title: Extend with Plugins & Workflows
steps.description: Attach custom plugins to preprocess, validate, transform, or enrich requests and responses—sequentially or in parallel.

steps.title: Monitor, Queue & Auto-Failover
steps.description: Track request flows, inspect queues, control batching, and enable seamless failover between providers when outages occur.

features.title: Key Features
features.description: Engineered for performance, reliability, and complete control of your LLM infrastructure.

items.title: Ultra-Low Latency Gateway
items.description: Built in Go with streaming, connection pooling, and optimized pipelines for sub-millisecond overhead on every request.

items.title: Unified Multimodel Interface
items.description: Standardized API across OpenAI, Anthropic, Groq, Bedrock, Vertex, Fireworks, LM Studio, and MCP tools—no SDK switching.

items.title: Hierarchical Virtual API Keys
items.description: Isolated API keys with per-team, per-user, and per-project limits, permissions, scopes, and audit logs.

items.title: AI Firewall & Zero-Trust Guardrails
items.description: Prompt injection defense, jailbreak detection, PII masking, and outbound blocking—executed in the request pipeline at wire speed.

items.title: Real-Time Budgets & Quotas
items.description: Token-level spend tracking with hard/soft budgets, dynamic throttling, and anomaly detection for runaway usage.

items.title: Adaptive Routing & Failover
items.description: Automatically choose the fastest, cheapest, or healthiest provider. Instant failover when latency spikes or outages occur.

items.title: Extensible Plugin Engine
items.description: Sequential or parallel middleware for validation, transformations, compliance, observability, or user-defined workflows.

items.title: High-Throughput Queues & Batching
items.description: Built-in request queuing, backpressure, concurrency controls, and micro-batching for heavy or long-running operations.

items.title: Deep Observability
items.description: Per-model, per-key, and per-tenant metrics, latency breakdowns, request traces, and replayable logs for debugging.

useCases.title: Perfect For
useCases.description: From startups to enterprises—Odock.ai handles your LLM infrastructure.

items.title: AI-Powered SaaS
items.description: Add AI features to your product without managing multiple API integrations.

items.title: Enterprise Teams
items.description: Control AI spending, enforce security policies, and audit every request.

items.title: Startups Scaling Fast
items.description: Scale usage behind a single API without vendor lock-in or complex migrations.

items.title: MCP-Enabled Workflows
items.description: Build complex AI workflows with model context protocol servers seamlessly.

offers.title: Choose How You Dock
offers.description: Whether you're just starting out or scaling to millions of requests, there's an Odock.ai plan for you.

cta.secondaryText: Not sure which plan is right for you? Join the waitlist and let us help you choose.

plans.title: Open Source
plans.subtitle: Self-Hosted
plans.description: Perfect if you love running your own stack.

plans.title: Managed Odock
plans.subtitle: Hosted by Us
plans.description: We run the dock, you ship the product.

plans.title: Enterprise
plans.subtitle: Private Network
plans.description: Designed for security, compliance, and scale.
features: Deploy on our cloud or yours

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Everything you need to know about Odock.ai.

items.question: What is Odock.ai?
items.answer: Odock.ai is an open-source unified API gateway that lets you access all LLM providers and MCP servers through a single endpoint. It includes API key management, quotas, security guardrails, and an extensible plugin marketplace.

items.question: How does the unified API work?
items.answer: Instead of managing separate API keys and integrations for each provider, Odock.ai acts as a middleware. You send requests to Odock.ai, and we route them to your chosen provider(s) with automatic fallbacks if needed.

items.question: How do security guardrails function?
items.answer: Our security layer automatically detects and blocks prompt injections, prevents sensitive data leakage, enforces rate limits, and filters outbound data—all without configuration required.

items.question: What providers are supported?
items.answer: We support OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Vertex, AWS Bedrock, Groq, Fireworks, and 50+ other LLM providers and MCP servers. New integrations are added regularly.

items.question: What are virtual API keys?
items.answer: Virtual API keys allow you to issue child keys for different teams, projects, or users without sharing your primary credentials. Each key can have custom quotas, rate limits, and audit trails.

items.question: How does the plugin system work?
items.answer: Plugins are middleware that execute sequentially or in parallel within the request pipeline. Build custom plugins for logging, webhooks, compliance checks, or any custom workflow.

items.question: Is Odock.ai open source?
items.answer: Yes! Odock.ai is fully open source under an MIT license. You can self-host, fork, or contribute to the project on GitHub.

items.question: How does fallback routing work?
items.answer: You can configure primary and fallback providers. If your primary provider fails, requests automatically route to the backup provider without interrupting service.

whyDifferent.title: Why It's Different
whyDifferent.description: Unlike traditional API gateways, Odock.ai is built specifically for LLMs with enterprise security baked in from day one.

codeCard.title: OpenAI-style usage
codeCard.description: Just replace the URL and virtual API key.

codeSnippets.python:
from openai import OpenAI

client = OpenAI(
    api_key="YOUR_VIRTUAL_API_KEY",
    base_url="https://your-gateway-url",  # ← replace with your URL
)

response = client.chat.completions.create(
    model="any-model",
    messages=[
        {"role": "user", "content": "Say hello from your gateway."},
    ],
)

print(response.choices[0].message.content)

reasons: Security-first design with guardrails always active
Prevent data leakage to external APIs automatically
Unified user & quota management across providers
Extensible plugin pipeline for custom integrations
